publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-3491.1# Jackie Baillie: The A82: The Case for Major Improvements and the Removal of the Temporary Traffic Lights at Loch Lomondside—As an amendment to motion (S2M-3491) in the name of Fergus Ewing, leave out from first "believes" to end and insert "believes that the A82 trunk road is an essential transport link for people living and working in the west of Scotland, the islands and the Highlands; further notes that the route is vital for tourism to Scotland’s first national park at Loch Lomond and the Trossachs and as the gateway to the west Highlands; acknowledges the HITRANS report which makes a persuasive case for investment in the A82; notes that improvements on economic and road safety grounds are required to the entirety of the route including the section to the north of Tarbet, and welcomes the development of a Route Action Plan by the Scottish Executive to address these concerns."

S2M-3491.1# Jackie Baillie: The A82: The Case for Major Improvements and the Removal of the Temporary Traffic Lights at Loch Lomondside—As an amendment to motion (S2M-3491) in the name of Fergus Ewing, leave out from first "believes" to end and insert "believes that the A82 trunk road is an essential transport link for people living and working in the west of Scotland, the islands and the Highlands; further notes that the route is vital for tourism to Scotland’s first national park at Loch Lomond and the Trossachs and as the gateway to the west Highlands; acknowledges the HITRANS report which makes a persuasive case for investment in the A82; notes that improvements on economic and road safety grounds are required to the entirety of the route including the section to the north of Tarbet, and welcomes the development of a Route Action Plan by the Scottish Executive to address these concerns." Supported by: Maureen Macmillan*
